meanings.definition: To gather and move a group of animals in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The farmer herded the cows into the barn for milking.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd herded the sheep into the pen before the storm.
meanings.sent3: The ducks herded together to form a quacking parade.
meanings.sent4: The children herded like little ducklings behind their teacher.
meanings.sent5: The border collie herded the scattered sheep with precision.

meanings.definition: To gather and move a group of people in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The tour guide herded the tourists onto the bus for the next stop.
meanings.sent2: The teacher herded the students into the classroom after recess.
meanings.sent3: The fans herded towards the stage for a glimpse of their favorite singer.
meanings.sent4: The security guard herded the crowd towards the exit after the event.
meanings.sent5: The event staff herded the attendees towards the registration desk.
